text: What is your role in the business and what does a typical day look like?
follow_up: Can you list the main tasks you personally handle in a normal day?

text: How much of your time is spent on the tools versus off the tools?
follow_up: Would you say it is mostly on the tools or mostly admin?

text: What work are you personally doing that should not require you?
follow_up: Can you name two or three examples?

text: If one key person was unavailable for two weeks, what would struggle or stop?
intent: Identify single point of failure risk
follow_up: Which specific areas would stop first?

text: What is the single biggest challenge in the business right now?
follow_up: Which one causes the most problems day to day?

text: When things get busy, what is the first part of the business to suffer?
follow_up: Can you give a recent example?

text: What problems keep repeating even after you think they've been fixed?
follow_up: What usually causes them to come back?

text: How do customers typically contact you?
follow_up: Which channel requires the most attention?

text: Roughly how much time do you spend each week on email and phone calls?
follow_up: Would you say it is more or less than five hours a week?

text: What software tools are currently used in the business?
follow_up: Which of these do you personally use most?

text: If only one area was improved in the next 30 days, which would make the biggest difference?
follow_up: Which one would have the fastest impact?

text: Looking 12 to 18 months ahead, what would working well look like for the business?
follow_up: What would be different compared to today?

text: Which areas of support would make the biggest difference right now?
follow_up: Which one should be addressed first?

text: What impact is this challenge having on your business or personal life?
follow_up: How is this affecting your time or energy?

text: Looking ahead, what would working well look like for you personally?
follow_up: What would you be able to do more of?
